entry.title: Dark Productivity
entry.content:
Tim Urban gave a TED talk where he jokingly suggests that we all have an instant gratification monkey in our minds. This monkey likes to lead us to what Tim coined as the "dark playground" where we enjoy regrettable, cheap entertainments.

I think the instant gratification monkey knows we're onto its nefarious ways, so it has developed something new: dark productivity.

This is the most insidious form of instant gratification. You think you're getting stuff done, but all you're really doing is shuffling cheap things around looking busy and avoiding what really matters.

entry.title: Hell Yeah or No
entry.content:
Derek Sivers recommends in this 1 minute youtube video to do things that are Hell Yeah and say no to everything else.

John Paul DeJoria, multi billionaire and co-founder of Paul Mitchell hair products, recommends to "Pay attention to the vital few and ignore the trivial many".

Warren Buffett advises, "The difference between successful people and really successful people is that really successful people say no to almost everything."

entry.title: Practice Makes Perfect
entry.content:
Step by step directions on how to get really good at something is still a mystery to us.

Giving robots specific instructions on how to walk only results in disjointed movements.

The way to get good is by practicing and learning from failure. Something magical happens after learning from failure thousands of times. Think of whatever you want to get really good at and put in the hours of practice.

entry.title: Fear of the Deep End
entry.content:
Dedicating yourself towards being extremely good is scary.

Grappling with the shortcomings of your abilities against the demands of what society wants and figuring out how to meet that demand can be daunting.

It's much easier to keep ourselves busy in the safety of the shallows.

entry.title: Progress Formula
entry.content:
Humans make progress by defining a problem and solving it by combining two things: knowledge and action.

Every obstacle towards progress is simply one more problem to solve.

We put a man on the moon because we discovered solutions to a plethora of problems and made the necessary actions to solve them.

entry.title: Define Happiness
entry.content:
Don't guess what makes you happy. Resist the urge to work, work, work and think you'll be happy when you're done.

What's your definition of happiness? Mine is gratitude. The more I am grateful, the more I find myself being happy.
